categories.name: Discovery & Taint
categories.description: Discovery demands and warrant challenge motions - WIN HERE

categories.name: Attack Counts (1-10)
categories.description: Conspiracy and first batch of wire fraud dismissals

categories.name: Attack Counts (11-20)
categories.description: Second batch wire fraud and procedural motions

categories.name: Oversight & Press
categories.description: Congressional referrals, DOJ complaints, media strategy

categories.name: Conditional/Pocket
categories.description: File only if specific triggers occur

motions.name: Motion for Continuance
motions.description: Request to postpone trial date to allow adequate defense preparation. MINIMUM 6 MONTHS REQUIRED.
motions.purpose: Buy prep time; extend trial deadline from April 22, 2026

motions.name: Rule 16 Discovery Demand
motions.description: Federal Rule of Criminal Procedure 16 - requires government to disclose evidence, documents, and materials relevant to the defense
motions.purpose: Obtain all evidence government intends to use; identify exculpatory materials

motions.name: Brady/Giglio Material Demand
motions.description: Constitutional requirement for prosecutors to disclose exculpatory evidence (Brady) and impeachment evidence (Giglio)
motions.legalBasis: Brady v. Maryland, 373 U.S. 83 (1963); Giglio v. United States, 405 U.S. 150 (1972)
motions.purpose: Force disclosure of Groff 302s, Five9 IVRs, plea agreement, cooperation terms

motions.name: Franks Motion
motions.description: Challenge search warrant based on 13+ false or misleading statements in the AOPC (Affidavit of Probable Cause)
motions.purpose: Invalidate search warrant; suppress all evidence obtained through tainted warrant
motions.status: THE MOTION - If granted, case collapses

motions.name: 4th Amendment Suppression Motion
motions.description: Request to exclude evidence obtained in violation of Fourth Amendment rights under invalid warrant
motions.legalBasis: Fourth Amendment; Exclusionary Rule; Fruit of Poisonous Tree
motions.purpose: Exclude all warrant-derived evidence; eliminate key prosecution exhibits
keyArguments: Good faith exception doesn't apply if reckless
motions.status: File WITH Franks motion as companion

motions.name: Napue Motion
motions.description: Challenge false Grand Jury testimony - Groff statements contradict documentary evidence
motions.purpose: Challenge false Grand Jury testimony; document Groff contradictions

motions.name: Motion to Dismiss - Conspiracy (Count 1)
motions.description: Eliminate conspiracy charge - no evidence of explicit agreement between defendant and Groff
motions.purpose: Eliminate anchor count; show no agreement evidence

motions.name: Motion to Dismiss Wire Fraud (Counts 2-10)
motions.description: Challenge first batch of wire fraud counts based on customer consent documentation
motions.purpose: Dismiss 9 wire fraud counts; IVR + DocuSign = customer consent = no fraud
motions.status: DEPENDS ON FIVE9 IVRs - Subpoena critical

motions.name: Motion to Dismiss Wire Fraud (Counts 11-20)
motions.description: Challenge second batch of wire fraud counts - same consent defense
motions.purpose: Dismiss remaining wire fraud counts; extend Phase 2 arguments

motions.name: Sanctions Motion
motions.description: Sanction government for pattern of misconduct: AOPC misstatements + Brady withholding + FBI victim page
motions.legalBasis: Fed. R. Civ. P. 37; Inherent Court Powers; 28 U.S.C. § 1927
motions.purpose: Document government misconduct pattern; preserve appeal issue
keyArguments: AOPC chart + Brady ledger + FBI page
motions.status: File after govt response if they double down

motions.name: Speedy Trial Motion
motions.description: Enforce Sixth Amendment speedy trial right; explore 5-year delay prejudice
motions.legalBasis: 6th Amendment; 18 U.S.C. § 3161 et seq.; Barker v. Wingo factors
keyArguments: Barker factors: length, reason, assertion, prejudice
motions.status: Backup - Preserves appeal even if denied

motions.name: Motion to Dismiss Tax Counts (Counts 21-27)
motions.description: Eliminate all 7 tax counts using Cheek defense - good faith reliance on CPA negates willfulness
motions.legalBasis: 26 U.S.C. § 7201, § 7203; Cheek v. United States, 498 U.S. 192 (1991)
motions.purpose: Eliminate 26% of total counts; CPA reliance defeats willfulness element
keyArguments: Cheek is legal defense not jury question
CPA Malcolm Smith ready to testify
ERC documents support legitimate tax position

motions.name: Bill of Particulars
motions.description: Force government to specify: which wires, which dates, which victims
motions.purpose: Lock government into specific theory; expose indictment vagueness
keyArguments: Indictment vague on wire count specificity
Locks govt into theory for trial
motions.status: Useful for trial - locks govt theory

motions.name: Vindictive Prosecution Motion
motions.description: Challenge 27-count superseding as retaliatory (6 → 27 counts after defense activity)
motions.legalBasis: Prosecutorial Vindictiveness Doctrine; Blackledge v. Perry
motions.purpose: Challenge charge escalation; feeds oversight campaign

motions.name: Rolling Discovery Motions
motions.description: Compel rolling discovery production; document government deficiencies weekly
motions.purpose: Enforce discovery rights; feed sanctions motion; document delays

motions.name: Motion to Sever
motions.description: Separate trials to avoid spillover prejudice from co-defendant Groff
motions.legalBasis: Fed. R. Crim. P. 14(a); Bruton v. United States
motions.purpose: Prevent spillover prejudice; separate Groff cooperation issues
motions.status: Only if trial proceeds - Keep in pocket

motions.name: Motions in Limine
motions.description: Pre-trial motions to exclude inflammatory/prejudicial evidence
motions.purpose: Exclude old audits, unrelated complaints, 'pattern' evidence

motions.name: Recusal Motion
motions.description: Remove Judge Schmehl if bias/impartiality issues surface - LAST RESORT
motions.purpose: Remove biased judge; preserve fair trial rights
keyArguments: Must have documented facts of bias
motions.status: LAST RESORT - Do not file without grounds

motions.name: Daubert Challenge
motions.description: Exclude/limit government expert opinions that fail reliability standards
motions.legalBasis: Fed. R. Evid. 702; Daubert v. Merrell Dow; Kumho Tire
motions.purpose: Exclude unreliable expert testimony; challenge methodology

phases.name: Phase 0: Preflight
phases.description: ACTIVE NOW - {{ATTORNEY}} negotiating continuance. MINIMUM 6 MONTHS REQUIRED.

phases.name: Phase 1: Discovery & Taint
phases.description: WIN HERE - Establish foundation through Discovery, Brady/Giglio, Franks, and Suppression

phases.name: Phase 2: Attack Counts (1-10)
phases.description: Target Conspiracy (Count 1) and Wire Fraud Counts 2-10

phases.name: Phase 3: Attack Counts (11-20)
phases.description: Continue Wire Fraud attack on Counts 11-20

phases.name: Phase 4: Attack Counts (21-27)
phases.description: Tax Evasion (21-24) and Failure to Pay (25-27) - CPA Good Faith Defense

phases.name: Phase 5: Oversight & Press
phases.description: Congressional referral, DOJ OIG complaint, House Judiciary, House Oversight, Press strategy

details.clientTask: DO NOT agree to anything under 6 months without calling attorney first
details.attorneyTask: {{ATTORNEY}} direct negotiation with AUSA. MINIMUM 6 MONTHS (October 22, 2026). If under 6 months offered, STOP and escalate.
evidence: J6 precedent: 12-24 month continuances for comparable volumes

counter.brief: REJECT - Below 6-month minimum. Counter with formal motion for 6+ months.
counter.full: DO NOT ACCEPT. This is below our 6-month floor. Response: (1) Thank AUSA for offer but indicate insufficient for case complexity, (2) Counter-propose 6 months minimum (October 22, 2026), (3) If rejected, immediately file Motion for Continuance with court citing: 315K documents, superseding indictment delay, J6 case precedents.

govtCounter.ifWeFile: Govt will oppose motion for 6+ months
govtCounter.theirArgument: Case has been pending sufficient time; defendant caused delays

ourRebuttal.brief: Govt had 2.5 years to investigate. Superseding indictment proves complexity.
ourRebuttal.full: (1) Government spent 2.5 years investigating - cannot claim case is simple. (2) Superseding indictment filed 7 months after original proves government itself needed more time. (3) 315K discovery pages produced late. (4) Cite J6 Capitol cases: 12-24 month continuances for comparable data volumes. (5) Due process requires adequate defense prep.
ourRebuttal.authority: 18 U.S.C. § 3161(h)(7)(A); U.S. v. Taylor (D.D.C. 2021) - J6 continuances

counter.brief: ACCEPT - Meets 6-month minimum. Proceed with full defense strategy.
counter.full: Accept 180 days. This meets our 6-month floor. Allows complete Phase 1-4 execution with proper briefing intervals. Maintains pressure while ensuring thorough preparation. Proceed with standard timeline. Document acceptance in writing.

counter.brief: ACCEPT - Exceeds minimum. Use for comprehensive defense preparation.
counter.full: Accept 360 days immediately. Use extra time for: (1) Comprehensive Everlaw analysis of all 315K docs, (2) Expert witness development - CPA, forensic accountant, (3) Parallel oversight/press strategy with congressional referrals, (4) Potential civil litigation prep. (5) Witness interviews and impeachment prep.

counter.brief: FILE MOTION SAME DAY - Motion for Continuance citing due process violation
counter.full: EMERGENCY PROTOCOL: (1) File formal Motion for Continuance within 24 hours, (2) Cite complexity: 27 counts, 315K docs, superseding indictment, (3) Request minimum 6 months (October 2026), ideal 12 months (April 2027), (4) Invoke 18 U.S.C. § 3161(h)(7)(A) ends-of-justice exclusion, (5) Request expedited hearing before Judge Schmehl.

govtCounter.theirArgument: Defendant waiving speedy trial rights; case simple; defendant causing delay

ourRebuttal.brief: 27 counts + 315K docs + superseding indictment = complex case requiring adequate prep
ourRebuttal.full: (1) We are NOT waiving speedy trial - we invoke ends-of-justice exclusion. (2) Case is NOT simple: 27 felony counts, 315K discovery documents, multiple fraud theories. (3) WE did not cause delay - govt filed superseding indictment 7 months after original. (4) Constitutional right to effective assistance of counsel requires adequate prep time. (5) J6 precedent: courts granted 12-24 months for similar volumes.

win.description: 6+ month continuance granted - proceed to Phase 1

details.clientTask: Review and approve motion filing; sign speedy trial waiver if required
details.attorneyTask: Draft and file Motion for Continuance citing 18 U.S.C. § 3161(h)(7)(A); prepare for opposition

counter.brief: WIN - Proceed with full Phase 1-4 execution
counter.full: Court has granted minimum acceptable continuance. Proceed immediately with Phase 1: Discovery & Taint motions. Standard briefing schedule applies. Document ruling for record.

counter.brief: IDEAL WIN - Maximum preparation time secured
counter.full: Court has granted ideal continuance. Use full year for: (1) Exhaustive discovery review, (2) Expert development, (3) Witness preparation, (4) Oversight/press strategy. Set internal milestones to maintain momentum.

counter.brief: PARTIAL - Below minimum but workable. File motion for reconsideration OR compress timeline.
counter.full: Court granted less than requested. Options: (1) File Motion for Reconsideration emphasizing specific prejudice, (2) If denied, compress Phase 1-4 into available time, (3) Prioritize highest-impact motions: Franks, Brady, Suppress, (4) May need to defer some count-specific motions.

govtCounter.theirArgument: Court has ruled; defendant got some continuance; case must proceed

ourRebuttal.brief: 3-4 months insufficient for 315K docs + 27 counts. Specific prejudice shown.
ourRebuttal.full: (1) Specify exactly what cannot be completed in time allotted, (2) Document Everlaw analysis showing pages-per-day requirement impossible, (3) Show specific motions that cannot be filed, (4) Expert witness unavailability, (5) Constitutional right to effective counsel being violated.

D.text: Court denies motion - April 22, 2026 trial date stands

counter.brief: APPEAL + COMPRESSED EXECUTION - Preserve issue for appeal while executing Phase 1
counter.full: Court has denied continuance. (1) File Notice of Interlocutory Appeal if available, (2) Preserve due process violation for post-trial appeal, (3) Execute compressed Phase 1: File Franks, Brady, Suppress immediately, (4) Request expedited briefing on all motions, (5) Document every instance of inadequate prep time for appellate record.

details.clientTask: Provide complete financial records, all communication logs, business documentation
details.attorneyTask: Draft comprehensive Rule 16 demand letter; identify specific discovery needs

A.text: Full compliance - produce all requested materials

counter.brief: Verify completeness; cross-reference with known evidence
counter.full: Review production for gaps. Compare against indictment exhibits. Identify any Jencks material withheld. Prepare supplemental demand if deficiencies found.

B.text: Partial compliance - claim privilege on some documents

counter.brief: Challenge privilege claims; demand privilege log
counter.full: File motion to compel privilege log per FRCP 26(b)(5). Challenge work product claims for factual documents. Request in camera review of disputed items.

C.text: Motion for protective order - sensitive materials

counter.brief: Oppose protective order; show necessity for defense
counter.full: Argue protective order unduly burdens defense preparation. Propose reasonable confidentiality measures. Cite defendant's Sixth Amendment right to effective assistance.

D.text: Delay tactics - request extension of time

counter.brief: Object to delay; invoke speedy trial concerns
counter.full: File opposition to extension. Cite government's superior resources. Note prejudice to defendant from delay. Request court impose production schedule.

details.clientTask: Identify potential exculpatory witnesses and evidence; document Groff credibility issues
details.attorneyTask: File formal Brady demand; document specific exculpatory evidence expected

counter.brief: Review for completeness; verify Giglio on all witnesses
counter.full: Examine production for all cooperator agreements, witness criminal histories, prior inconsistent statements. Verify 302s produced for all interviews.

counter.brief: Document known exculpatory evidence; file motion to compel
counter.full: Itemize specific Brady material known to exist: Groff's cooperation agreement, financial records showing legitimate business, Five9 IVR recordings. Request sanctions for non-disclosure.

counter.brief: Challenge redactions; demand unredacted versions
counter.full: File motion challenging overbroad redactions. Request in camera review. Argue defendant entitled to complete impeachment material under Giglio.

D.text: Request in camera review by court

counter.brief: Support in camera review; prepare specific questions
counter.full: Prepare detailed submission for court identifying specific documents and why each is material to defense. Request presence at in camera review if permitted.

details.clientTask: Draft D1-D5; AOPC chart showing misstatements; compile exhibits
details.attorneyTask: Review D6; improve citations; file CM/ECF

counter.brief: 8+ misstatements documented = pattern, not isolated error
counter.full: Document each misstatement with exhibit reference. Cite Third Circuit pattern standard from Wilson v. Russo. Show reckless disregard for truth. Request evidentiary hearing.

B.text: Probable cause survives excision of challenged statements

counter.brief: Remove Groff statements + omissions = NO PC remains
counter.full: Demonstrate that removing tainted Groff statements and material omissions leaves insufficient independent basis for PC. Use AOPC timeline to show warrant dependency on false info.

counter.brief: Franks standard met: specific allegations + offer of proof
counter.full: Cite Franks v. Delaware two-prong test. Show specific false statements identified. Provide offer of proof through attached exhibits. Request hearing to develop record.

counter.brief: No good faith when affiant made knowing/reckless false statements
counter.full: Good faith exception under Leon inapplicable where affiant himself made misstatements. Cite Third Circuit holding that good faith cannot save warrant based on deliberately or recklessly false information.

win.description: Franks hearing granted - CASCADE to suppression

details.clientTask: Provide all details about wire transfer origins and authorization chain
details.attorneyTask: Draft suppression motion; research Fourth Amendment issues

counter.brief: Accept partial win; argue for broader suppression
counter.full: Document government concession. Argue fruit of poisonous tree extends to all derivative evidence. Request complete suppression of all warrant-derived material.

B.text: Oppose - argue good faith exception applies

counter.brief: Good faith fails where warrant facially deficient
counter.full: Argue Leon good faith exception inapplicable: (1) affiant lied; (2) magistrate abandoned judicial role; (3) warrant facially deficient; (4) affidavit so lacking PC that no reasonable officer would rely.

C.text: File sur-reply with additional case authority

counter.brief: Respond with distinguishing authority
counter.full: Analyze government's new cases. Distinguish on facts. Cite more recent Third Circuit authority. Request oral argument to address new issues.

counter.brief: Welcome hearing - prepare witness examination
counter.full: Prepare cross-examination of case agent. Subpoena relevant witnesses. Prepare demonstrative exhibits showing timeline of constitutional violations.

win.description: Evidence suppressed - CASCADE to wire dismissal

details.clientTask: Document preparation needs; list outstanding discovery
details.attorneyTask: File continuance motion; propose new schedule

counter.brief: Finalize agreed order; confirm new dates
counter.full: Draft proposed order with specific new deadlines. Coordinate with court clerk. Confirm expert witness availability for new dates.

B.text: Oppose - case has been pending sufficient time

counter.brief: Document complexity; cite superseding indictment delay
counter.full: Show case complexity: 27 counts, 315K discovery documents, superseding indictment filed 7 months after original. Argue government cannot create delay then oppose defense continuance.

counter.brief: Accept compromise if workable; counter-propose if not
counter.full: Evaluate if shorter period allows adequate preparation. If insufficient, document specific tasks requiring additional time. Propose middle-ground schedule.

D.text: Request speedy trial waiver as condition

counter.brief: Carefully evaluate waiver terms
counter.full: Review waiver language carefully. Ensure waiver is limited to specific period. Preserve speedy trial arguments for any future delays caused by government.

details.clientTask: Document lack of agreement evidence; show Groff acted independently
details.attorneyTask: Draft dismissal motion; cite Third Circuit conspiracy standards

counter.brief: Accept win; preserve for appeal if partial
counter.full: Document dismissal ruling. If government appeals, prepare opposition brief. Use ruling to support remaining motion arguments.

counter.brief: No agreement proof - Groff wasn't in room for key decisions
counter.full: Challenge government's evidence of agreement. Show Groff made decisions independently. Cite emails where Groff acted without defendant's knowledge. Request Franks-type hearing on conspiracy evidence.

counter.brief: Hearsay rules require independent proof of conspiracy first
counter.full: Cite Third Circuit requirement that conspiracy must be proven by independent evidence before co-conspirator statements are admissible. Challenge circular reasoning.

counter.brief: Welcome hearing - expose lack of agreement evidence
counter.full: Prepare to cross-examine case agent on specific evidence of agreement. Show government relies entirely on Groff's self-serving statements. Document lack of documentary proof.

details.clientTask: Compile Five9 IVR recordings; DocuSign consent records for Counts 2-10
details.attorneyTask: Draft dismissal motion targeting first batch of wire counts

counter.brief: Accept partial win; extend reasoning to remaining counts
counter.full: Document which counts dismissed. Show same consent evidence exists for all counts. File supplemental brief extending dismissal argument.

counter.brief: IVR + DocuSign = customer consent = no fraud
counter.full: Present IVR recordings showing disclosures made. DocuSign proves customer signed. No fraud where customer fully informed and consented. Challenge 'scheme' characterization.

counter.brief: No reasonable jury could find fraud with documented consent
counter.full: Cite standard: even on summary judgment, court must assess sufficiency of evidence. Complete consent documentation negates fraud as matter of law.

counter.brief: Agree to conference; use to narrow issues
counter.full: Use Rule 16 conference to establish undisputed facts about consent documentation. Lock in government's theory for later impeachment.

details.clientTask: Compile Five9 IVR recordings; DocuSign consent records for Counts 11-20
details.attorneyTask: Draft dismissal motion building on Phase 2 arguments

counter.brief: Accept full wire fraud dismissal
counter.full: Document complete wire fraud dismissal. Prepare for government appeal. Use ruling to strengthen tax count defense.

B.text: Oppose - distinguish from earlier dismissed counts

counter.brief: Same evidence, same result - consent proven
counter.full: Show government cannot distinguish these counts. Same IVR system, same DocuSign process. If consent defeated earlier counts, it defeats these.

counter.brief: Pattern of legitimate business, not fraud
counter.full: Reframe pattern: consistent compliance procedures, uniform consent documentation, standard business practices. Pattern proves legitimacy.

D.text: Request consolidated hearing with Phase 2 motion

counter.brief: Agree to consolidation - efficiency benefits defense
counter.full: Consolidated hearing allows comprehensive presentation of consent evidence. Prevents government from re-litigating settled issues.

details.clientTask: Draft brief; compile CPA records from Malcolm Smith
details.attorneyTask: Review; coordinate with CPA; file CM/ECF

counter.brief: Accept complete tax dismissal - 26% of case eliminated
counter.full: Document complete dismissal of Counts 21-27. Government case reduced to wire fraud only. Strengthen remaining defense strategy.

counter.brief: Good faith reliance on CPA negates willfulness as matter of law
counter.full: Cite Cheek v. United States - good faith belief negates willfulness element. Document complete reliance on licensed CPA Malcolm Smith. Show no evidence defendant knew returns were incorrect.

C.text: Argue reliance defense goes to weight not admissibility

counter.brief: Reliance defense can warrant dismissal when undisputed
counter.full: Distinguish cases where reliance was disputed. Here, CPA records are uncontroverted. No rational jury could find willfulness when defendant followed professional advice completely.

D.text: Request evidentiary hearing on CPA reliance

counter.brief: Welcome hearing - CPA testimony will be compelling
counter.full: Prepare CPA testimony documenting all advice given. Subpoena complete file. Show defendant followed every recommendation. Demonstrate no willful intent.

win.description: Tax counts 21-27 dismissed - CASCADE to Oversight

details.clientTask: Finalize oversight letters; prepare press materials
details.attorneyTask: Review referral letters; coordinate timing with court filings

counter.brief: Cooperate fully; provide all documentation
counter.full: Prepare comprehensive submission for OIG. Document all Brady violations, prosecutorial misconduct, and procedural irregularities. Request status updates.

counter.brief: Prepare congressional briefing materials
counter.full: Draft comprehensive briefing for House Judiciary Committee. Focus on systemic issues. Propose reforms. Prepare for potential testimony.

counter.brief: Coordinate with Oversight Committee staff
counter.full: Provide documentation for Oversight investigation. Focus on DOJ accountability. Support broader reform efforts.

D.text: Referrals acknowledged but no immediate action

counter.brief: Follow up systematically; escalate if needed
counter.full: Maintain regular contact with all oversight bodies. Document all communications. Prepare media strategy if official channels unresponsive.

win.description: Oversight investigation opened - CASCADE to Press

details.clientTask: Approve press release; prepare for interviews
details.attorneyTask: Coordinate media outreach; manage press inquiries

counter.brief: Expand to regional and national outlets
counter.full: Leverage local coverage for broader reach. Contact legal media (Law360, Above the Law). Prepare op-ed for national publication.

counter.brief: Provide exclusive access for in-depth coverage
counter.full: Offer exclusive interview to major legal publication. Provide comprehensive documentation. Focus on systemic reform message.

counter.brief: Evaluate opportunities carefully
counter.full: Review documentary and book proposals. Ensure editorial control over narrative. Focus on vindication and reform message.

counter.brief: First Amendment protects public discussion
counter.full: Reject any gag order attempts. Court filings are public record. Defendant has right to tell his story. Challenge any prior restraint.

cascades.description: Continuance secured - proceed to Phase 1 Discovery & Taint
Franks win establishes warrant invalidity, strengthening suppression
Suppression eliminates evidence base for wire fraud counts
Brady disclosure strengthens Franks showing of misstatements
First wire batch dismissal creates precedent for remaining counts
Any major win triggers oversight referral

steps.description: Click any blue defense node to reveal the government's possible responses

steps.title: Explore A/B/C/D Responses
steps.description: Click any response option (A, B, C, or D) to see our prepared counter-punch

steps.title: Follow Cascade Lines
steps.description: Green animated lines show how wins unlock subsequent strategic moves

steps.title: Use Phase Selector
steps.description: Switch between phases to see the complete litigation strategy

steps.description: Switch between vertical and horizontal tree layouts
